PR_152321b.java - Win32 API version of the code

I've had a chance to look into this and have improved scrolling on the desktop.  Please get the latest code from HEAD and try it again for the table.  NOTE:  I have not touched the tree scrolling code so don't bother restesting it.

I have included PR_153231b.java that creates the same table as your example code.  It contains a flag VIRTUAL that you can use to toggle virtual/non-virtual behavior.  The code uses only Win32 API which means that this is about as fast as you can possibly get.  If scrolling in this example is not acceptable, then it's time to write a C code example.

NOTE:  There are many more optimizations that I can do but I won't be able to look at this again until next week.  Please retest the old code and run PR_153231b.  If the non-VIRTUAL case is "fast" for you, I can make the non-VIRTUAL case in SWT "fast" too.

Part of the problem with saying something is "slow" is that "slow" is subjective.  I was horrified when I ran your example on WM2003, then I ran the Win32 API version and it wasn't much better (for me).  If everything is still too slow, then I will construct a benchmark that measures times and we can compare some concrete numbers.

Thank you for entering this bug report and following up with us.  Talk to you next week.
